howard.edu.sycs363.spring15.SimpleAddressBook

Class AddressBookConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • howard.edu.sycs363.spring15.SimpleAddressBook.AddressBookConnection

  • public class AddressBookConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    The AddressBookConnection class is an abstraction layer over consumable db queries pertaining to retrieving specific information stored in the address_book database (specifically in the address_info table). Exposed functionality include retrieving, deleting and inserting entries into the address_info table.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressBookConnection()
      Attempts to make a connection to the db hosting all information for address books.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddressBookConnection

        public AddressBookConnection()
                      throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                             java.sql.SQLException
        Attempts to make a connection to the db hosting all information for address books. The constructor will throw an exception if the attempt fails
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - can be thrown if the MySQL connector driver is not properly referenced
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while connecting to the db

    • Method Detail

      • getPeopleWithIdentifier

        public java.util.List<Person> getPeopleWithIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get a list of people that were identified by the provided identifier
        Parameters:
        identifier - identifies address book entries belonging to a unique address book identified by the identifier
        Returns:
        the list of people in the address book that have been marked with the identifier. Returns an empty list, if there is no associated entry
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while trying to access people's information in the database

      • deletePeopleWithIdentifier

        public void deletePeopleWithIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete people that were identified by the provided identifier
        Parameters:
        identifier - identifies address book entries belonging to a unique address book identified by the identifier
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while trying to access people's information in the database

      • savePeopleWithIdentifier

        public void savePeopleWithIdentifier(java.util.List<Person> people,
                                     java.lang.String identifier)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Save the list of people that are identified by the provided identifier.

        NOTE: The existing information, in the DB, of people that can be identified by the provided identifier will be flushed/deleted before provided list is saved to the DB

        Parameters:
        people - list of people that will be saved into the database
        identifier - identifies address book entries belonging to a unique address book identified by the identifier
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while trying to access people's information in the database

      • purgeDb

        public void purgeDb()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete all rows in the address_info table
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can be thrown if there is a sql error while trying to access people's information in the database
